blocks.Title: Study in Canada
blocks.Subtitle: Your Academic Journey Begins Here
blocks.description:
A Canadian education is more than a degree - it is a pathway to global opportunity, lifelong connections, and a future without borders.

Canada's education system delivers high-quality programs from secondary school to post-graduate study. Each year thousands of international students choose Canada to advance their education, build their future, and unlock long-term immigration pathways.

blocks.Heading: Your 4-step success roadmap
blocks.description: Move from acceptance letter to permanent residence with a clear plan at every stage.

blocks.Heading: Your 4-step success roadmap
blocks.description: Follow these four phases to study, work, and settle in Canada.

Cards.title: Step 01 - Assess and apply
Cards.description: Select the right school and program while preparing a complete application.

Cards.title: Step 02 - Study and work
Cards.description: Understand on-campus, off-campus, and co-op opportunities while you study.

lists.listItem: Off-campus work eligibility (20 hours per week)

Cards.title: Step 03 - Post-graduation work permit
Cards.description: Prepare early so you qualify for Canada's PGWP program.

Cards.title: Step 04 - Apply for permanent residence
Cards.description: Use Canadian education and experience to qualify for PR pathways.

blocks.Heading: Study permit eligibility and documentation
blocks.description: Understand the core requirements and paperwork for a strong study permit application.

items.listItem: Letter of acceptance from a Designated Learning Institution (DLI)
Proof of funds covering tuition, living costs, and return travel
Background checks or police certificates when requested
Medical exam if required by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Demonstrate intention to leave Canada after studies

blocks.Heading: Required documents
blocks.description: Gather these documents before submitting your study permit application.

Cards.title: Letter of acceptance
Cards.description: Issued by your Designated Learning Institution. Status: Required.

Cards.title: Proof of identity
Cards.description: Valid passport or travel document. Status: Required.

Cards.title: Proof of funds
Cards.description: Tuition, living costs, and return travel. Status: Required.

Cards.title: Letter of explanation
Cards.description: Statement of purpose outlining study goals. Status: Optional.

Cards.title: Provincial/Territorial Attestation Letter
Cards.description: PAL or TAL confirming your study spot allocation. Status: Required unless exempt.

blocks.Heading: Provincial/Territorial Attestation Letter (PAL/TAL)
blocks.description: Confirm whether you need a PAL or TAL under the current provincial study quota.

blocks.Heading: PAL/TAL guidance
blocks.description: Check your program type to see if the attestation letter is required.

lists.listItem: Extensions at the same institution and level
Issued after you accept admission and pay any required deposit
Requested by the Designated Learning Institution on your behalf
Valid through the current provincial allocation period

blocks.Heading: Medical exam requirements
blocks.description: You may need a panel physician exam if any of the following apply.

Cards.title: Healthcare or education settings
Cards.description: Required for studies that involve work with patients, children, or vulnerable people.

Cards.title: Extended stay
Cards.description: Mandated when you plan to remain in Canada for longer than six months.

Cards.title: High-risk countries
Cards.description: Needed if you have lived in a country with higher health screening requirements.
